page.title: 16A Walk Near Burmarsh
page.content: We walked along the Lower Wall Road with high ground on our right, and flat land running down towards the sea on our left. Lympne Castle was silhouetted on the skyline, and on the ridge there were clumps of blue-green trees, some turning yellow, for autumn was approaching. The grey stones of Stutfall Castle lay on the green slopes, and on the flat land there were sheep and black and white cattle. The trees in the lane were red with haws, and on the other side of a low hedge there was dark, newly ploughed soil. Ducks and geese called from the canal, and the sounds carried in the cool air. Rushes bent and rustled in the ditches and the great grey-blue bowl of the sky covered us.
